abstract: School attack in Trollhattan, Sweden, in which two people were killed, is ruled hate crime, based on evidence that suspect Anton Lundin Pettersson acted on prejudice against immigrants.
lead_paragraph: A spokesman for the regional police said the nature of the attack, and evidence found in the suspect’s apartment, suggested that he was a right-wing extremist.

headline.main: Sweden School Attack, Treated as a Hate Crime, Prompts Soul-Searching
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Sweden: Sword Attack Was a Hate Crime, Police Say

snippet: A spokesman for the regional police said the nature of the attack, and evidence found in the suspect’s apartment, suggested that he was a right-wing extremist.
